section.title: Mailing Lists
section.p: If you want to write a longer comment, send patches or thing, the best way is probably by using the pingus- mailing lists, subscribe information can be found below, to send a mail to the list write to < href="mailto:pingus-devel@nongnu.org?subject:[non-member]">pingus-devel@nongnu.org.

ul.li: pingus-devel - Pingus Developer List (for general discussion about the game, the development, etc.).

section.p: There is currently no pingus-users mailing list due to the of traffic, so using the pingus-devel list for questions about game is perfectly ok.

section.title: Bug Reports
section.p: If you want to submit a bug report about Pingus or simply the list of open bugs, you can do so the Issue Tracker. Submitting stuff there should make it that it doesn't get lost.

section.title: IRC
section.p: For a quick help you can try the IRC server < class="irc">irc.freenode.net:6667 and the channel < class="irc">#pingus, you can find the project (nick: grumbel) there most of the time. From time to time will also be IRC Meetings with larger parts of the team, once such meetings happen, they will get announced in news section.

section.title: Instant Messaging
section.p: If you don't like IRC, there is also the possibility to us directly via Instant Messaging.
